title: How to Make Smiles on a Keyboard

methods.name: On Windows Keyboards With Numeric Keypads

steps.headline: Click on the location where you want to insert the symbol.
steps.description: If your keyboard doesn't have a dedicated numeric keypad but has one as a sub-function of other keys, press Fn or NumLock to activate the numeric keypad. Even if the keys are unlabeled, the keypad will still work when Num Lock is on.

steps.headline: Press Alt.
Press 1 on the keypad for ☺.
Press 2 on the keypad for ☻.
Click on the location where you want to insert the symbol.
steps.description: This method only works in applications that support Unicode, like WordPad.

steps.headline: Type 263a and press Alt+X for ☺.
Type 263b and press Alt+X for ☻.
Click on the location where you want to insert the symbol.
Click on Edit in the menu bar.
Click on Emoji & Symbols….
Alternatively, press ⌘+Control+spacebar to launch the dialog box.
Click on the smiley you want to insert.
Click on the location where you want to insert the smiley.
Press Ctrl+⇧ Shift+U
Type 263a and press ↵ Enter for ☺.
Type 283b and press ↵ Enter for ☻.
Click on the location where you want to insert the smiley.
Type :).
steps.description: It will instantly be converted into ☺.

steps.headline: Tap in the location where you want to insert the symbol.
Tap ?? .
steps.description: This is the key for the Emoji keyboard and it's located to the left of the spacebar. If you have additional keyboards installed, tap and hold ?? , then tap Emoji.

steps.headline: Tap ??   at the bottom of the screen.
Tap the smile emoji you want to insert.
Tap in the location where you want to insert the symbol.
Tap ?123.
steps.description:
It's to the left of the spacebar:
Type :) for ?? . Type :, then tap ABC and type D for ?? .

text:
On Windows Keyboards With Numeric Keypads Click on the location where you want to insert the symbol. If your keyboard doesn't have a dedicated numeric keypad but has one as a sub-function of other keys, press Fn or NumLock to activate the numeric keypad. Even if the keys are unlabeled, the keypad will still work when Num Lock is on. Press Alt.  Press 1 on the keypad for ☺.  Press 2 on the keypad for ☻.  On Windows Programs Using Unicode Click on the location where you want to insert the symbol. This method only works in applications that support Unicode, like WordPad. Type 263a and press Alt+X for ☺.  Type 263b and press Alt+X for ☻.  On Mac Click on the location where you want to insert the symbol.  Click on Edit in the menu bar.  Click on Emoji & Symbols…. This launches a dialog box. Alternatively, press ⌘+Control+spacebar to launch the dialog box.  Click on the smiley you want to insert.  On Chromebook Click on the location where you want to insert the smiley.  Press Ctrl+⇧ Shift+U  Type 263a and press ↵ Enter for ☺.  Type 283b and press ↵ Enter for ☻.  On Microsoft Office Applications Click on the location where you want to insert the smiley.  Type :). It will instantly be converted into ☺. On iPhone Tap in the location where you want to insert the symbol.  Tap ?? . This is the key for the Emoji keyboard and it's located to the left of the spacebar. If you have additional keyboards installed, tap and hold ?? , then tap Emoji. Tap ??   at the bottom of the screen.  Tap the smile emoji you want to insert.  On Android (using Gboard) Tap in the location where you want to insert the symbol.  Tap ?123. It's to the left of the spacebar:
Type :) for ?? . Type :, then tap ABC and type D for ?? .
